posts._title: Deepa Dhanraj – Kya hua is shahar ko? AKA What Has Happened to This City? (1986)
posts.title: Kya hua is shahar ko?
posts.excerpt: From the Berlinale website:A pioneering political work of contemporary relevance: Communal violence between Hindus and Muslims in 1984 forms the starting point for this film, whose complexity lends it immense political force. The film’s historical perspective is provided by a thorough commentary, which gives the camera’s particular presence the necessary depth and complexity. The mechanisms …
posts.titleEnglish: What Has Happened to This City?

posts.title: Fighting Mad
posts.excerpt: An Arkansas farmer stages a one-man war against corrupt land developers who want to evict him and his neighbors from their farms for real estate developments.

posts._title: Heinosuke Gosho – Jinsei no onimotsu aka Burden of Life (1935)
posts.title: Jinsei no onimotsu
posts.excerpt: Quote:“Rooted in “salaryman” comedy and family drama, Burden of Life represents a marked advance over Gosho’s previous three shomin comedies. It placed sixth in the 1935 Kinema Jumpo polling, and has been praised by Burch for its seriousness and slice-of-life quality. Concurring with this judgment, John Gillett finds the film “imbued with a naturalistic tone …

posts.title: Toula ou Le génie des eaux

posts._title: Sergei M. Eisenstein & Jay Leyda – Eisenstein’s Mexican Film: Episodes for Study (1958)
posts.title: Eisenstein’s Mexican Film: Episodes for Study
posts.excerpt: Quote:In 1954, Upton Sinclair donated 100,000 feet of film shot by Sergei Eisenstein in Mexico to the Museum of Modern Art. From this footage, Jay Leyda, assisted by Manfred Kirchheimer, created an almost four hour long assemblage titled “Eisenstein’s Mexican Film: Episodes for Study.” The film is silent with explanatory titles. The MOMA footage was …

posts._title: Tamae Garateguy – Mujer lobo AKA She Wolf (2013)
posts.title: Mujer lobo
posts.excerpt: She Wolf is a serial killer who traps her men in the subway in Buenos Aires. She seduces, has sex with them and kills them. But one of those men is a police officer who is investigating her crimes. Running away from him she meets a dealer with whom she stars a relationship. This romance …

posts.title: Long Shot
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘A budding Scottish film producer tries to get his ambitious Aberdeen-set western financed, and while he attracts some major stars and directors to the film he finds that with their support come more and more script changes… Filmed around the 1977 Edinburgh Film Festival, Long Shot is a deadpan satire about the trials and tribulations …

posts._title: Boris Barnet & Aleksandr Macheret – Stranitsy zhizni aka Pages of Life (1948)
posts.title: Stranitsy zhizni
posts.excerpt: Nina arrives as a young lost girl in a factory, but soon shows great qualities as a human being, curious of knowing more and learning. History comes across her way.

posts._title: Joaquim Pedro de Andrade – A Linguagem da Persuasão AKA The Language of Persuasion (1970)
posts.title: A Linguagem da Persuasão
